result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshaun C Hosey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn was previously in court for Deshaun C Hosey.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting an additional status, needs additional discovery. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
at county expense, signed and filed.

Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in court.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense. The court appointed Atty. Lori Kuehn, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Defendant is not required to reimburse Milwaukee County. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Deshaun C Hosey.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing, Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in court with Attorney Jade K Hall; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Shawn Halverson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense would like an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with A.M.S., J.A.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Deshaun C Hosey in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
